result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S Hoskins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence and Waukesha Co. 17CF1141

superMiscConds.notes:
lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. 
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall have no contact with Walmart.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including

records.addlTxt: Clerk: EZ. Defendant Michael S Hoskins in court.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Michael S Hoskins.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. No contest plea entered.  Court finds def guilty and enters judgment.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael S Hoskins in court.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Michael S Hoskins. Atty. Jensen states there is a resolution with a complex agreement and request an adjournment for plea form to be filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael S Hoskins in court.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Michael S Hoskins.  Defendant waives reading of the Information.  Not guilty plea entered.  Atty. Jensen anticipates proceeding to joint plea/sentencing.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael S Hoskins in court.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Michael S Hoskins. Counsel's first appearance. Atty. Buckett states the defendant is requesting substitute counsel and the SPD office contacted Atty. Jensen and Atty. Jensen is able to accept the case and Atty. Buckett moves to withdraw.  Court permits Atty. Buckett to withdraw.  Case recalled at 9:25 a.m.  Atty. Nolan Jensen now appears with the defendant.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.
Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael S Hoskins in court.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Court orders $500.00 signature bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
